basics.name: T Tirabassi
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: Bachelors of Arts in Information & Computer Sciences from the University of Hawaii.

education.institution: University of Massachusetts Boston, Boston, MA

work.company: University of Hawai'i/Department of Hawaiian Home Lands
work.summary: Conducted research on broadband connectivity and economic development on Molokaʻi as part of a University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa internship program in collaboration with the Department of Hawaiian Home Lands (DHHL).
highlights: Worked closely with the DHHL to explore current issues faced by Moloka'i residents
Visited the island of Moloka'i and met with various community members on island
Assist students and faculty with systems and services across all UH and CC locations
Collaboration with on campus tech-based departments

work.summary: Performed culturally choreographed shows for onboard guests
highlights: Entertain, teach, and interact with guests in regards to performances
Guide guests through hula lessons and produce welcoming environment

Activities.summary: The world's largest educational and scientific computing society
Uh Manoa club that focuses on the development of student produced game projects.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Awarded to students who earned a semester gpa of 3.5 on the basis of full time enrollment of 12 credits or more.

awards.title: Dean's Merit Scholarship
awards.awarder: University of Massachusetts Boston Dean's Office
awards.summary: Scholarship awarded to a select group incoming college freshmen who have demonstrated extraordinary academic achievement throughout high school.
